8.22.17  1:00 pm   Hi Bill. Something strange happened to me last night. I had this feeling that I just really wanted to lay down and close my eyes. The more time that passed the harder it was to keep my eyes open... I finally closed them. Next thing I remember, I open my eyes to find that it was about 8 hours later. And I have no recollection  of those 8 hours passing... but I felt oddly refreshed. What happened?

     i'm not sure

     Did I travel through time?

     yes

8.22.17  12:52 pm   Can something be both normal and weird simultaneously?

     i think everything is

      Like a duck-billed platypus is strange because it's an egg laying mammal... but it's normal for a platypus to lay eggs. If somebody found a platypus that gave live birth that would be much more weird, since they're supposed to lay eggs. So the platypus laying eggs is both normal and weird?

8.22.17  10:01 am   i tried to find everything i've ever written; stories, fictions, novel ideas, lyrics, text roleplays, one-shots, prompts, poems and even the stupid weird, you know, "things" from primary school. i gathered all of them and checked them over to see if they are useful, to take the good ones and finish projects.
after all this time i didn't write anything but a scenario for a school play, probably because it destroyed my whole life and i gave everything i had to it (i thought it would be a simple and small play since we do it for school but since i always want to do everything perfect, i somehow kinda became the director and wrote 13000 fucking words, with history researching, songs, stage decor, costumes, lighting etc it took 7 damn months of my life and i even fucking translated a nurse's journal and a soldier's war letters in Ottoman Turkish which was simply Arabic, a language that i don't know, for play to be realistic), i hoped reading m y old wo rks would make me do something.
it didn't. i don't know why i stopped doing what i do best. maybe i was tired and no matter what i do, i can't encourage myself to start again but i have to. it's not about inspiration, i am always creative but sometimes power of imagination is too much and i feel like i'm going insane. i want to write about whole universe(s) but i can't, and possibilities every little thing creates...
so this is the situation. i am sorry, it's long but i needed to tell. and the question is: should i complete my old projects, creating in a small scale like you said or should i go after the one i have always wanted to do which can change my life by starting all over? there is another choice, i can use my good works for beginning that big project but i'm so fucking afraid that i'll never be able to finish it.

     ah, you are drowning in infinity. this will probably be confusing and hopeless for a little while longer, just keep brainstorming and thinking of different possibilities.... just when you think there's no solution, you'll realize that you are actually safe on solid ground, and instead of drowning it's actually just raining infinity. so just get some cups

8.22.17  7:48 am   Doesnt a tritone substitution basically mean just moving a half step down into the chord?

     i think it's supposed to be a 7th chord with a tritone in it

      Like in C, you'd play a Db instead of G to move to C.

     Db7 instead of G7

      But I thought moving a chord either a half step up or a half step down to the 'target chord' was a trick that works no matter what chord your playing?

     in this school of thinking, 7th chords descending chromatically is a legit and normal thing, just like 7th chords moving down a fifth / up a fourth is considered legit. in either case, the internal tritone harmony (B and F notes in a G7 chord) can be seen as moving down chromatically regardless.

     Like if you playing a blues song in C and for the little V-IV-I turnaround you hit a G#7 before going to the G7... would that be a tritone substitution too (the 5th of G is D, tritone of D is G#)? 

     i think tritone substitution refers to any time you have a 7th chord with the tritone harmony in it (like a G7 chord contains the notes B and F) and then you switch the bass note for a Db note, which essentially makes a Db7 chord instead, because the core notes (B, F) are the same. Additionally, any other notes you were using in the chord can usually translate to the other, and usually a light-dark or dark-light transformation occurs. for example if you had G7 with 9, 13, (the 'light' notes) and you flip the bass to Db, and leave all the same notes, they become the 'dark' notes on the Db7 so it becomes Dbaug7#9. This whole line of thinking is generally only applicable in the school of thinking that the notes B and F with G in the bass should resolve to C and E, with C in the bass. or B and F with Db in the bass resolve to F# and A# with F# in the bass. so why not switch
